instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3476: What is 820-3476? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U6100: What is U6100? this is an SPI ROM chip that holds the BIOS which is necessary for the machine to POST or try and power on..
definitions.U5110: What is U5110? This chip is responsible for SMC_RESET_L in many Macbook models..
definitions.SMC_RESET_L: What is SMC_RESET_L? SMC_RESET_L puts the SMC into reset mode when it is low, _L means the signal is present when voltage is low. The SMC being in reset mode keeps it from running..
definitions.SMC_LID: What is SMC_LID? SMC_LID tells the machine the system is open when it is 3.3v to 3.4v, and closed when it is low such as 0v-0.6v. When this signal is low, the machine may go to sleep or have no backlight. .
definitions.SMC_MANUAL_RST_L: What is SMC_MANUAL_RST_L? SMC_MANUAL_RST_L resets the SMC when low.   _L means whatever before the _L in the signal name is asserted when it is low voltage, such as 0.0v to 0.5v..
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on from power button unless reconnect battery
threads.message: I'm working on <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> which came for no power. It had some slight corrosion on JTAG, around <RESISTOR>R7202</RESISTOR>, <CHIP>U7600</CHIP>, some on <CAPACITOR>C3201</CAPACITOR> area and really small stain on <CHIP>U6100</CHIP>. I have removed JTAG, cleaned eveything, replaced damaged resistors, caps, resoldered chips (<CHIP>U6100</CHIP> too). Computer turns on, works on battery and on the charger. Problem is, that SOMETIMES when I turn it off it will not turn on from power button. I have to reconnect battery, then it starts working again for some time. It olny happens when battery is conected. When on charger power button works every time. I have tried new keyboard, new battery and even replaced SMC with new one. Sadly there is no differenece... Diagnostisc shows no errors, when computer is on it works perfectly fine..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on from power button unless reconnect battery
threads.message:
You may have a problem with <SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> level.
Clean and resolder all components in <CHIP>U5110</CHIP> area.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on from power button unless reconnect battery
threads.message: I have cleaned that area, replaced <CHIP>U5110</CHIP>. Still the same. After plugging battery <SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> is 2,8V. This time when I plugged charger  there was a chime but no image or backlight on the screen. I have measured <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL>: when lid is opened voltage is stable 2,6V, when cloesd it' jumping between 0,113V to 1,10V. After performing PRAM and SMC reset the image is back and <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> voltage is 0,9-1,1V wneh lid closed. I have noticed, that if I perform SMC reset it always powers up with power button. Could be another bad SMC?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on from power button unless reconnect battery
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> is too low on 2.8V; is practically near its treshold point.
Check voltage on all <CHIP>U5110</CHIP> pins.
Pay atention to <RESISTOR>R5127</RESISTOR> and continuity to pin 3/<CHIP>U5110</CHIP>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on from power button unless reconnect battery
threads.message:
Sorry, I made a mistake.. The <SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> is 3,41V. <SIGNAL>SMC_MANUAL_RST_L</SIGNAL> is 2,8V. 

<CHIP>U5110</CHIP> pin voltages:

1 - 3,43V
3 - 3,44V
4 - 2,8V
5 - 3,41V
6 - 3,42V
7 - 3,44V
8 - 3,29V

<RESISTOR>R5127</RESISTOR> has 0ohm resistance and has continuity to <CHIP>U5110</CHIP>. I have checked all resistors around <CHIP>U5110</CHIP>, they are ok.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on from power button unless reconnect battery
threads.message:
There is a problem with <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL>.
I hope you've measured it correctly.

Check <RESISTOR>R5250</RESISTOR> and <RESISTOR>R5171</RESISTOR>.
Also inspect Hall sensor (J5250) for corrosion.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on from power button unless reconnect battery
threads.message: Bullseye! I took off J5250 and <SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> was completely eaten away. Now computer works fine. There was no ign of corrosion in this area... Anyway, thank you very much for your help!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on from power button unless reconnect battery
threads.message:
"I took off J5250"
Need to replace the Hall sensor, or machine will not go to sleep, when close the lid.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on from power button unless reconnect battery
threads.message: Of course I have replaced it ðŸ˜‰
